definition: special duty (e.g. extra security or traffic control on special occasions)/person on special duty
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
Kul Tigin or Kultegin (685-c. 731), general of the Second Turkic Kaganate

sentences.english: The specialist acted as an intermediary between the police and the kidnapers .
sentences.chinese: 這位特勤擔任警方與綁架案中間的協調者。

sentences.english: The Secret Service is part of the Department of Homeland Security.
sentences.chinese: 特勤局隸屬於國土安全部。

sentences.english: I believe it was the only request the Secret Service ever made that I refused.
sentences.chinese: 我想這是我唯一一次拒絕特勤處的請求。

sentences.english: The United States Secret Service has made definitive connections between the supernote and the government of North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 美國特勤局認爲超級美鈔和北韓政府有確切的聯繫。

sentences.english: Secret Service returns Palmer to the hotel suite.
sentences.chinese: 特勤處送帕默返回了酒店套房。

sentences.english: At the Palmer power plant breakfast, Jack is apprehended by Secret Service.
sentences.chinese: 在帕默舉辦早餐會的電廠裏，傑克被特勤處逮捕了。

sentences.english: Secret Service Agent Pierce helps Jack secure the building.
sentences.chinese: 特勤處特工皮爾斯幫助傑克將酒店保護起來。

sentences.english: It is an inevitable tendency to construct professional fire-control army.
sentences.chinese: 專業化是反恐鬥爭中消防特勤隊伍建設的必然趨勢。

definition: SWAT (Special Weapons And Tactics)/riot police/abbr. for 特種警察|特种警察[te4 zhong3 jing3 cha2]
field work/field personnel/any occupation that involves a great deal of field work
geographical area of command/(PLA) military district
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
group/a large body of/production brigade/military group
